Definitions: The financial institution or entity providing the loan for the construction phase of the project.
The individual or entity receiving the loan and responsible for repaying it according to the agreement.
Effective Date is the date that the agreement goes into effect;
The total amount of money that the Construction Lender agrees to lend to the Customer for the project.
The duration over which the loan must be repaid, including any interest and fees.
A timetable outlining specific milestones at which the Customer can draw funds from the loan.
A fee charged by the Construction Lender to the Customer for reserving the loan funds.
Expenses incurred during the finalization of the loan agreement, including legal fees, appraisal fees, and other associated costs.
The percentage charged on the loan amount by the Construction Lender as the cost of borrowing.
The date by which the loan must be fully repaid, including principal and any accrued interest.
The entity or individual that receives the loan and is obligated to repay it under the terms of the agreement.

A condition where the borrower fails to meet the financial or other contractual obligations stipulated in the Loan / Security Agreement, such as missed payments, breach of terms, or failure to achieve mapped milestones, potentially leading to legal and financial consequences.
Individuals or entities that agree to repay the loan if the Borrower defaults.
The obligations of the Borrower to provide regular updates and financial reports to the Construction Lender.
Indicates whether a forebearance agreement is included as part of the Subscriber Manager Agreement; 'Y' for yes, there is a forebearance agreement, 'N' for no, there is not
